Package nzilbb.ag

Interface GraphMediaProvider

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IGraphMediaProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileMediaProvider, StoreGraphMediaProvider
    public interface GraphMediaProvider
    Interface for objects that provide access to media for a given graph.
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      MediaFile[] getAvailableMedia()
      List the media available for the graph.
      String getMedia​(String trackSuffix, String mimeType)
      Gets a given media track for the graph.
      GraphMediaProvider providerForGraph​(Graph graph)
      Provides another instance of the implementing class, for the given graph.

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableMedia

        MediaFile[] getAvailableMedia()
                       throws StoreException,
                              PermissionException
        List the media available for the graph.
        Returns:
        List of media files available for the given graph.
        Throws:
        StoreException - If an error occurs.
        PermissionException - If the operation is not permitted.

      • getMedia

        String getMedia​(String trackSuffix,
                String mimeType)
         throws StoreException,
                PermissionException
        Gets a given media track for the graph.
        Parameters:
        trackSuffix - The track suffix of the media - see MediaTrackDefinition.suffix.
        mimeType - The MIME type of the media.
        Returns:
        A URL to the given media for the given graph, or null if the given media doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        StoreException - If an error occurs.
        PermissionException - If the operation is not permitted.

      • providerForGraph

        GraphMediaProvider providerForGraph​(Graph graph)
        Provides another instance of the implementing class, for the given graph. The main use for this method is to allow graphs to generate fragments that have their own media providers.
        Parameters:
        graph -
        Returns:
        A new object that can provide media for the given graph, or null if none can be provided.
